CSCPlots 0.0.0.9000

Print expression bar graph for genes/transcripts most highly expressed in selected putative CSCs.

printBarchartSingleTranscriptNoStacking.Rd

This function prints a bar graph to display expression in the genes most highly expressed in a selected set of putative CSCs. The order is by mean transcript expression in the pCSC cells i.e. highest first. If the no_ribo parameter is used, the same bar graph is printed with all transcripts with "ribosomal" in their full name removed from the results.

printBarchartSingleTranscriptNoStacking(
  tExprMatr,
  pCSC_group_positions,
  pCSC_group_name,
  outDir,
  tissue_type,
  family_type_name,
  patient_source_name,
  no_ribo = TRUE,
  number_of_transcripts_to_show = NULL,
  HUGO_abbreviations_and_fullnames = NULL,
  HUGOFullNameFilesDir = NULL
)

Arguments

tExprMatr

Expression matrix describing a cancer single-cell population; column names should be gene names, row names should be cancer cell names.
pCSC_group_positions

Row number of CSCs in the CSC group in the expression matrix tExprMatr.
pCSC_group_name

Name of CSC group to print preferential expression plots for e.g. 'pCSC_group_1_SC4_Talazoparib.LB17011', but can be anything.
outDir

Output directory for plots.
tissue_type

Name of tissue type e.g. 'CDX'; can be anything.
family_type_name

Name of the gene group type; usually 'HUGO'.
patient_source_name

Optional: Name of the patient sample that CSC cells are from; just name for in the plot title, can be anything.
no_ribo

Optional: Set to 1 to remove ribosomal transcripts from some of the bar charts
number_of_transcripts_to_show

Optional: Number of transcripts to include.

Value

Nothing returned.
